definition: twists and turns/vicissitude/complication/difficulty/effort/CL:番[fan1]
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
week/weekly/variant of 周[zhou1]
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
variant of 折[zhe2]/to fold
to spend (much) effort/to go through (a lot of) trouble

sentences.english: Stendhal took a lot of time and care in deciding what the title of his novel would be.
sentences.chinese: 司汤达在确定这部作品的书名时还是颇费了一番周折。

sentences.english: These will struggle should they need to raise money in the markets.
sentences.chinese: 如果它们要在市场融资，将需要费一番周折。

sentences.english: I found his little house with no trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我没费周折就找到了他的小房子。

sentences.english: After much effort, he finally found the relatives he'd lost touch with for many years.
sentences.chinese: 几经周折，他终于找到了失散多年的亲人。

sentences.english: After a long effort , media helped him to contact her.
sentences.chinese: 几经周折，媒体帮他联系上了日本的她。

sentences.english: And it is also a big headache to have it opened at home.
sentences.chinese: 及至拿到或运到家中，打开时也是煞费周折。

sentences.english: After many setbacks, the mother acts finally legalized .
sentences.chinese: 几经周折，母亲的行为终于合法化了。

sentences.english: But it took him a while to get to the semis , so I'm happy for him.
sentences.chinese: 不过他确实费尽周折才进入半决赛，我为他感到高兴。
哦，那并没有费多大的周折。

sentences.english: It took them great effort to assemble after landing on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 着陆后，这些小伙子花费了很多周折才重新聚集起来。

sentences.english: After trying hard, I got a job in a gold mine.
sentences.chinese: 几经周折，我才在一家金矿找到一份工作。

sentences.english: Only after many setbacks was success achieved.
After many difficulties and postponements, the ship was ready for launching.
sentences.chinese: 该船几经周折拖宕后，已准备下水。

sentences.english: This, they say, makes all the trouble of getting home worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 基于这些，他们表示，回家再周折也是值得的。

sentences.english: They had difficulty in fighting their proposal through.
sentences.chinese: 他们颇费周折才使提议得到批准。

sentences.english: The painting was able to display several twists and turns.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画几经周折才得以展出。

definition: tremendous strength (idiom)
pinyin: jiu3 niu2 er4 hu3 zhi1 li4

definition: to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to spend (much) effort/to go through (a lot of) trouble
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to save/to get rid of (so saving space)
to go through numerous (setbacks, revisions etc)
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to take great pains/to go to a lot of trouble
to take time/time-consuming
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to toss about in bed/from person to person/indirectly/to wander
to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander
as easy as pie
countless difficulties/extremely difficult/against all odds
to go to war (idiom)/to make a big fuss over sth
to try one's very best to persuade sb (idiom)/to reason with sb in every way possible
